page.title: 08Market Hill - The Shire Hall
page.content:
The{Shire Hall}on Market Hill was built in the early 1570's as a court-house and is still used as such today. The ground floor has also been used as an open-market until just before world war two, the top floor being supported by brick arches that were filled in during 1803. On the roof used to be two fire sirens which were used after the building was restored in 1884, when it was briefly used as a fire station before it became the petty sessions court. Visitors can still see in the brick work the arches once used to admit the carts and people to the market.
{St. Mary's.}
